name: Holiday Inn Express Suites Chehalis - Centralia

reviews.text: Great hotel with spacious rooms and friendly staff. The staff were helpful and patient. There were cookies available when we arrived, plus everyone got a little treat upon check in (microwave popcorn + a few chocolates). They served a good warm breakfast -- everything from omelets and biscuits and gravy to a very interesting pancake machine. Cereal, hardboiled eggs and yogurt were also available. Lots of room to eat in the breakfast area. The pool area was warm and clean. The hot tub was lukewarm, which was the only downside. The pool itself was large enough for an adult to swim short laps if they wanted to, but also good for kids to play in. Reasonable price, quick on-off to I-5 make this hotel a winner.
reviews.title: Very nice, great service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best HIE ever, This hotel is quite new, Our room was spacious and clean, well appointed and our king size bed was extra comfy!!!!!!!!!!!! We felt safe.
reviews.title: Best Holiday Inn Express !

reviews.text: As always for me what makes something really great is the "Service" and it was outstanding, From a friendly front desk, pleasant housekeeping and and a general manager "Todd" who went above and beyond to help us out after we had an car accident on the 1-5 while on our way home to BC, Long tale but Todd went far beyond his required duties and helped us on our way. This will be my go to place in I am in Chehalis for sure. I highly recommend the Holiday Inn Express if in Chehalis.
reviews.title: One of the best!

reviews.text: This hotel is one of the better ones! We were greeted with treats for everyone (even the kids - microwave popcorn and candy) upon our arrival. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The pool area was lovely and warm and the pool was heated. They have a large spacious breakfast room which made eating with a family comfortable. The management at this hotel cares and it shows.
reviews.title: Clean, quiet, well maintained and a good value
Could be 5 stars
reviews.text: This was my second stay at this hotel and I was again impressed. The hotel is right off of I-5 so it is very convenient for travel. However this is not the only reason to stay there.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for a large,clean and comfortable room you should look no further as this meets all criteria in spades!
reviews.title: Excellent overnight stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are not a lover of 'biscuits & gravy' as we are not you may be a little disappointed with the breakfast but could fill up with cereal and muffins so need not go hungry.
reviews.title: It Strives to be the Best in the Area

reviews.text: We were on the road side so were not troubled by train noise but the noise from the road was too loud to sleep with the window open as we would have preferred.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

reviews.text: Would not hesitate to stay here again if we were in the area.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On a two week trip through the Pacific Northwest, we stayed at mostly B & B's and boutique hotels, but this HI Express was quite impressive. We picked this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews, and it definitely lived up to the hype. It had been a while since we stayed in an HI Express, and were surprised by the quaiity of the room and excellent service. The lady at the front desk when we checked in was as energetic and enthusiastic as any hotel employee we've dealt with in a while (and we travel frequently). The hotel looks fairly new, and our King Room was large and just as nice as what you see in the better Hampton Inns and Hilton Gardens. The free breakfast also seemed a cut above the competition.
reviews.title: Excellent Service---Very Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located only a block or so off I-5, but our room faced to the back and we got little expressway noise. However, it should be noted that a main railroad line is not far from the hotel, and you will get some train noise. We found Chehalis to be a nice town for an overnight stop, with a lovely downtown which has some good restaurants (Mackinaws was very good). Good place to stop before going on to see Mount St. Helens. Overall, we had a comfortable and very pleasant one-night stay.
reviews.title: Good place for a nice stay

reviews.text: The rooms at the HI Express at Chehalis are nice and clean, people are friendly and the hotel is quite new. It's an excellent place to stay when you like to visit the factory outlets at Centralia or want to make a tour to Mount Rainier.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay in Lewis County

reviews.text: Each year I enjoy spending a week in July with my husband as we visit my Grandma. The Holiday Inn feels like home when we come into town. It is nice to be recognized each year we return. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Breakfast is a treat. Internet access is readily available. Plenty of parking on site. Can't wait to return next year.
reviews.title: What will you do with the time that's been given to you?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Someday I'm going be in a position to buy a hotel and when that happens the two women that I want to run it are Penny from the Chehalis Holiday Inn Express Cassidy from the Seattle Center Holiday Inn Express,
reviews.title: Very nice hotel!

reviews.text: The Holiday Inn located in Chehalis, WA. is probably one of the newer hotels in Chehalis. The management have been totally 100% community supporters and the rooms are a great value. Easily located off of I-5. They have a very nice conference room for presentations and or meetings.
reviews.title: Holiday Inn Express is a great place to stay

reviews.text: This is an awesome hotel... on every level. Ranging from sharp looking and comfortable rooms, to the nicest complimentary breakfast I have had in years... the HI Express will not disappoint you.
reviews.title: If staying in the area, look no further than the Holliday Inn Express, as it is FANTASTIC!!!

reviews.text: Further, the hotel has a large indoor pool and hot tub which is nice to relax at morning or night.My only MODEST complaint was that the chlorine level in the pool seemed excessive.
reviews.title: Clean, Friendly and Quiet!

reviews.text: Location wise, again it is spot on, one block off of I5, and close to the steam train, shopping and other area attractions. In short, you can't go wrong at this hotel. As for train noise, if you close the windows, you will barely hear them. And if noise is an issue, ask for a room facing away from the tracks.
reviews.title: Clean and restful stay!

reviews.text: Pam and her team are FANTASTIC. So friendly, welcoming and helpful. I instantly felt like these women were genuine and always stopped to chat with us as we came and went. We stayed for 4 nights in a room on the 4th floor facing the front of the hotel. We never heard the train or the flag pole. The room was super clean, spacious, with all the amenities we needed. The internet was a tad slow for my needs of conducting meetings via Microsoft Lync but I was able to use my Verizon hot spot that worked brilliantly. The morning breakfast offered many options and each morning I had something new. There are a few nice restaurants around the hotel that helped add to the small town charm. We will definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Ask for ear plugs!

aka: Holiday Inn Express Suites Chehalis Hotel Chehalis
description: Welcome to a new Chehalis/Centralia, Washington hotel! The new Holiday Inn Express & Suites Chehalis/Centralia conveniently located near downtown Chehalis and halfway between Seattle & Portland. Leisure travelers can enjoy a comfortable stay at our Chehalis/Centralia hotel which is minutes from restaurants, shopping & local attractions. Centralia Factory Outlets, Mount St. Helens, Lewis County Historical Museum are all near our hotel in Chehalis & are great for family outings. Adults can spend an evening at the Lucky Eagle Casino or watch the races at South Sound Speedway. With convenient access to Weyerhaeuser Company Research Center, Michael s Distribution Center, Providence Centralia Hospital & Sierra Pacific, our hotel is ideal for business travelers who plan to attend meetings in the area. A 24-hour business center & free high-speed Internet access throughout the hotel, will help you stay connected as you do business on the road. During your stay at our Chehalis/Centralia hotel, take time to enjoy the fabulous amenities. You can relax in the heated, indoor pool & whirlpool or work-out in the fitness center. Every morning, a free Express Start hot breakfast bar is available in the lobby.
